0fe9066c-566b-4fe3-9a43-51e8bfca66f5.description: The Community Edition All-Star Badge is awarded to learners that complete 10 modules available within the RangeForce Community Edition platform. All-Star learners demonstrate clearly-defined skills across foundational cybersecurity concepts by completing hands-on cyber range exercises. Register for the Community Edition here: https://go.rangeforce.com/community-edition-registration
0fe9066c-566b-4fe3-9a43-51e8bfca66f5.name: Community Edition All-Star

badge_template_activities.title: Successful completion of Community Edition modules.

82f28981-9944-4cc9-81e3-c73509db53fa.description: This Elite Badge is awarded to learners who have completed the capstone challenge for the SOC Analyst 1 path. Elite Badge earners demonstrate clearly-defined skills and resilience by successfully completing hands-on cyber range challenges on the RangeForce platform.
82f28981-9944-4cc9-81e3-c73509db53fa.name: SOC Analyst 1 Elite

alignments.name: CREST
alignments.description: CREST is the not-for-profit accreditation and certification body representing the technical information security industry. CREST provides internationally recognised accreditation for organisations and individuals providing penetration testing, cyber incident response and threat intelligence services.

badge_template_activities.title: The SOC 1 Analyst capstone requires you to monitor, identify, and prevent threats like phishing with the use of Suricata, Fail2Ban, and the Splunk stack.

f2ed5abf-cce6-45a7-9f87-317da1d3f175.description: The SOC Analyst 1 path enables cybersecurity professionals and students to gain live-environment experience with the foundational concepts and practices of a security operations center (SOC). Whether it’s understanding event logs, visualizing data, or conducting malware analysis, this curriculum is designed to get you SOC-ready. Work through a series of hands-on modules and related challenges to complete this path.
f2ed5abf-cce6-45a7-9f87-317da1d3f175.name: SOC Analyst 1

alignments.name: Crest
alignments.description: CREST is the not-for-profit accreditation and certification body representing the technical information security industry. CREST provides internationally recognised accreditation for organisations and individuals providing penetration testing, cyber incident response and threat intelligence services.

badge_template_activities.title: Successful completion of all modules and challenges included in the SOC Analyst 1 path.

e28a5555-fb01-451d-a750-6eb2c79e8bbe.description: The Ransomware Ready badge shows that you are well equipped to recognize and understand the most prevalent ransomware variants of 2021. The variants in this course make up over 75% of all recorded ransomware attacks of that year. This course will help you to identify common ransomware attack techniques ranging from initial access to impact. The variants covered in this path include: Ryuk Ransomware RansomEXX Ransomware REvil Ransomware BlackMatter Ransomware Hades Ransomware
e28a5555-fb01-451d-a750-6eb2c79e8bbe.name: Ransomware Ready

badge_template_activities.title: Completion of 8 modules within the Introduction to Ransomware course

718f0715-7e12-442a-8ed7-cafad0346c0d.description: This badge is awarded to members of the RangeForce Community Edition who completed Level 1 of the three available cyber skills challenges during the Persistence Challenge. Participants demonstrated the ability investigate logs and malicious activity in our cyber range – featuring real IT infrastructure and real security tools. This challenge took place between July 21, 2021 and August 8, 2021. Sign up for Community Edition here: https://go.rangeforce.com/community-edition-registration
718f0715-7e12-442a-8ed7-cafad0346c0d.name: Persistence Challenge

badge_template_activities.title: Learner completed the first of the three available cyber skills challenges. This accomplishment is equivalent to approximately one hour of training.

798c0e6d-cab1-45ce-b334-ccb5f32c79d0.description: The SOC Challenge badge is awarded to members of the RangeForce Community Edition platform who complete the Email Challenge, the first challenge of the three available cyber skills challenges during the SOC Challenge. Participants demonstrated ability to find security threats associated with phishing, spoofing, malware, and link analysis in our cyber range – featuring real IT infrastructure and real security tools. This challenge took place between May 14, 2021 and May 31, 2021.
798c0e6d-cab1-45ce-b334-ccb5f32c79d0.name: SOC Challenge

badge_template_activities.title: Learner completed the first of the three available cyber skills challenges: Email challenge, Finding Patterns with Yara challenge, or SOC Detection challenge. This accomplishment is equivalent to approximately one hour of training.

907e70ab-4b18-409b-979f-fe8644c8bb16.description: This path is targeted at learners who require a broad skill set to perform multiple roles in their organization’s security program. This path ranges from foundational to more advanced concepts and is recommended for those with 1-3 years of experience in IT support and/or programming functions but want to learn more about essential security topics.
907e70ab-4b18-409b-979f-fe8644c8bb16.name: Cybersecurity Essentials

alignments.name: Crest

f452f2a6-a19a-4347-9535-a395bcdc8dff.description: The SOC Analyst 2 path is a great resource for entry-level analysts looking to take their career to the next level. In this path, you’ll work through hands-on modules to develop robust skills, including more sophisticated search capabilities, utilizing APIs and SIEMs to automate repetitive tasks, and incorporating the right tools into incident response. During our course challenges, you’ll demonstrate the resilience you bring to teams by applying your skills to incident response.
f452f2a6-a19a-4347-9535-a395bcdc8dff.name: SOC Analyst 2

alignments.name: CREST
alignments.description: CREST is the not-for-profit accreditation and certification body representing the technical information security industry. skills.name: Be Able To Create Perfect Incidents And Manage Incidents

ea7a8eb3-2c30-47bf-908a-c9e2a45bb400.description: The Blue Team Star Challenge badge is awarded to members of the RangeForce Community Edition platform who completed at least one of three available cyber skills challenges during the Blue Team Star Challenge. Participants demonstrated resilience while defending a network against cyberattacks in our cyber range – featuring real IT infrastructure and real security tools. This challenge took place between December 11, 2020 and January 10, 2021.
ea7a8eb3-2c30-47bf-908a-c9e2a45bb400.name: Blue Team Star Challenge

badge_template_activities.title: Learner completed at least one of three available cyber skills challenges: Threat Intel challenge, Email Obfuscation challenge, or Multi-Attack challenge. This accomplishment is equivalent to approximately three hours of training.

bf73f09c-e5e7-4045-8ef5-fd5c3c350f89.description: The Cybersecurity Awareness Month badge is awarded to members of the RangeForce Community Edition platform who complete all the modules in the Network Forensics and Reverse Engineering courses. Earners demonstrate hands-on experience with network forensics tools and reverse engineering principles. This challenge took place between October 1, 2021 and October 31, 2021. Register for Community here: https://go.rangeforce.com/community-edition-registration
bf73f09c-e5e7-4045-8ef5-fd5c3c350f89.name: Cybersecurity Awareness Month

badge_template_activities.title: Learner completes 10 modules in reverse engineering and network forensics.

328cbe59-e30a-44af-9b2b-c6a596adc9a8.description: The Ransomware Hunter badge shows that you are well equipped to identify and respond to some of the most prevalent attack techniques used in human-operated ransomware campaigns. You will learn to utilise various detection capabilities to identify network, signature, and behaviour anomalies to stop ransomware earlier in the kill chain. Furthermore, you will understand how to prevent initial access and mitigate the overall threat of ransomware.
328cbe59-e30a-44af-9b2b-c6a596adc9a8.name: Ransomware Hunter

badge_template_activities.title: Successful completion of specific Ransomware modules

10563697-fbc7-4f88-9b60-028e275816b8.description: This badge is awarded to members of the RangeForce Community Edition who completed the Malicious Process Challenge. Participants demonstrated the ability to use Splunk to find and trace malicious processes in an operating system. This challenge took place between March 10th and March 31st. Sign up for Community Edition here: https://go.rangeforce.com/community-edition-registration
10563697-fbc7-4f88-9b60-028e275816b8.name: Malicious Process Challenge

badge_template_activities.title: Learner completed the Malicious Process Challenge module. This accomplishment is equivalent to approximately one hour of training.

32db1137-6506-4836-a35a-d83b0063da07.description: The Microsoft Security Core path is designed to sharpen your skills in Microsoft products. If you’re just getting started, this Battle Path will introduce you to key aspects of managing and defending a Windows environment. Gain a working understanding of Active Directory and Group Policy, learn to analyze Windows event logs, and practice common security tasks you can use on the job. Apply your skills through relevant challenges, including how to investigate malware on a Windows computer.
32db1137-6506-4836-a35a-d83b0063da07.name: Microsoft Security Core

alignments.name: CREST

d06755f7-f97c-4f51-9cce-313f96c81ad7.description: The learner can investigate, analyze and solve incidents as a Tier 2 analyst using ELK Stack in the Elastic Elite. Each step is designed to allow the learner to practice the obtained knowledge and skills from the Elastic learning path. This hands-on approach enables the learner to avoid a real-life scenario-based ransomware attack from escalating.
d06755f7-f97c-4f51-9cce-313f96c81ad7.name: Elastic Elite

badge_template_activities.title: Successful completion of the Elastic Capstone Challenge

7d7bcebe-4564-4f9e-badd-00737a06c353.description: In this RangeForce Community Edition quarterly challenge, users will need to remove an old Kubernetes deployment and set up a new one with some minor configuration.

c4b0651e-e104-4c85-9897-412d232d19f1.description: These two courses give you the fundamental understanding and practice of building an effective offensive strategy within your enterprise. Work through a series of academic and hands on modules to complete this path. This path takes approximately 8 hours to complete.
c4b0651e-e104-4c85-9897-412d232d19f1.name: Cymulate RangeForce

badge_template_activities.title: Successful completion of all modules and challenges included in the two Cymulate Security Validation Courses: 1. Building an Effective Offensive Security Program and 2. Understanding Offensive Security – Hands On.

e44985dc-af97-40d4-a643-66ea95f21b79.description: Content in this path is aligned to the top MITRE ATT&CK techniques on the Red Canary 2020 threat report. Earners of this badge have shown hands-on experience with execution, persistence, privilege escalation, and defense evasion techniques.
e44985dc-af97-40d4-a643-66ea95f21b79.name: MITRE ATT&CK

54e5b3e1-adb2-47ff-9232-ab4fc4a73b88.description: The Threat Hunter path is our most advanced blue team training for those who have mastered enterprise security operations. In this path, we’ll introduce you to the practices and techniques employed by attackers, from the tools at their disposal to the way they view and target systems. Exercise your threat hunting skills in the cyber range through a variety of interactive challenges that are designed to give you a better understanding of targeted attacks.
54e5b3e1-adb2-47ff-9232-ab4fc4a73b88.name: Threat Hunter

66bcbf56-9096-46ce-bb35-db9edb03099a.description: In the Elastic learning path, the learner will work through a series of hands-on modules and related challenges to complete this path. The learner acts as an Elastic engineer or analyst and uses ELK Stack possibilities in various situations of malware detection, investigation, threat hunting, and reporting. Each module focuses on an ELK Stack component and its uses.
66bcbf56-9096-46ce-bb35-db9edb03099a.name: Elastic

badge_template_activities.title: Successful completion of all modules and challenges included in the Elastic Learning Path.

837a1122-ec3f-4239-9087-a3b9bed8a8e0.description: Earners of this badge demonstrate understanding of the various types of offensive security assessments and how to prepare for them in the following areas: legal, budgeting, scoping, and preparing technical test environments.
837a1122-ec3f-4239-9087-a3b9bed8a8e0.name: Junior Penetration Tester

a08aed20-73dc-49ac-92fe-d9ea37184431.description: The Secure Coding path is designed for software developers, testers, and architects who design and develop software in various programming languages and platforms, including desktop, web, cloud, and mobile. Secure Coding learners will improve their ability to deliver software that is secure and private.
a08aed20-73dc-49ac-92fe-d9ea37184431.name: Secure Coding

6e6890ab-747c-471d-8810-6971aaa7cd65.description: The Web Application Security (OWASP) path is critical training for any application engineer masteringeeded to eliminate the most common application vulnerabilities. Supporting a "shift-left" development strategy, our training covers all ten of the OWASP vulnerabilities through hands-on, interactive training. By completing this training, you’ll demonstrate your ability to apply key web application security principles to real world uses.
6e6890ab-747c-471d-8810-6971aaa7cd65.name: OWASP

alignments.name: CREST
alignments.description: CREST is the not-for-profit accreditation and certification body representing the technical information security industry. CREST provides internationally recognised accreditation for organisations and individuals providing penetration testing, cyber incident response and threat intelligence services.

6c13744f-bdb1-4593-80b9-019c67421f39.description: This path is targeted at learners who are responsible for protecting the security and privacy of organizations and personnel using IoT systems. Earners of this badge know how to approach managing the security and data privacy of IoT throughout the entire lifecycle. Through a combination of hands-on activities and case studies, learners know how to successfully identify and remediate vulnerabilities that undermine IoT security, as well as strategies for managing risk and securing data.
6c13744f-bdb1-4593-80b9-019c67421f39.name: IoT Security Practitioner

alignments.description: CREST is the not-for-profit accreditation and certification body representing the technical information security industry. badge_template_activities.title: Successful completion of all modules in the IoT Security Practitioner path.

67507ec0-cd6e-4c4b-ae1e-9edecb9d4021.description: This course gives you the fundamental understanding of today’s most effective practices to ensure data is properly organized and protected from outside threats. Work through a series of modules taught by industry experts to complete this path. This path takes approximately 8 hours to complete.
67507ec0-cd6e-4c4b-ae1e-9edecb9d4021.name: Cymulate Cyber Hygiene Pro

badge_template_activities.title: Successful completion of all modules and challenges included in the Cymulate Expert Knowledge – Cyber Hygiene Course

717ed8d9-6bf5-4903-bd22-5367d13d1e9d.description: The goal of Malware Analysis' capstone challenge is to gauge yourself by performing a complete analysis of the provided malware sample. This capstone challenge will require you to apply the knowledge and skills learned throughout the learning path to complete the requested tasks. It is advised to complete the modules of the Malware Analysis learning path before attempting the capstone challenge.
717ed8d9-6bf5-4903-bd22-5367d13d1e9d.name: Malware Analysis Elite

badge_template_activities.title: Complete the Malware Analysis Capstone challenge.

d29a7eb9-52be-49fd-996e-7c72756b6235.description: The Reverse Engineering path is targeted at individuals who are looking to gain knowledge in reverse engineering to specialize in a field that requires it, such as security research or malware analysis. Earners of this badge have shown hands-on experience with assembly language, x86 architectural knowledge, binaries, and static and dynamic analysis.
d29a7eb9-52be-49fd-996e-7c72756b6235.name: Reverse Engineering

37797798-15c4-4c5c-b436-68a366c8ff50.description: The Malware Analysis learning path is a perfect fit for the individuals interested in malware analysis as a career or an additional skill. The learning path is split into 4 courses, each representing different stages of the analysis process. IndividualsM are introduced to analysis tools and techniques used in each stage and engaged with hands-on exercises to gain practical experience.
37797798-15c4-4c5c-b436-68a366c8ff50.name: Malware Analysis

badge_template_activities.title: Successful completion of the Malware Analysis Learning Path.
